titleInfo.title: USA v. Mendoza-Ramirez
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Defendants unopposed oral motion to continue 30 is granted and the change of plea hearing is continued to August 6, 2008 at 1:00 p.m. before the undersigned magistrate judge in Courtroom 2, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska. The time between today's date and the anticipated plea of guilty, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act as to Luis P. Mendoza-Ramirez. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. ( GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mendoza-Ramirez
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant Luis P. Mendoza-Ramirez. It is ordered that:... (2) There are no disputed matters regarding the presentence report and the proper computation of the advisory Guidelines ranges.(3)Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mendoza-Ramirez
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE sustaining 62 Motion for Preliminary Forfeiture as to Luis P. Mendoza-Ramirez (1). Based upon Count II of the Indictment and the Defendant's plea of guilty, the United States is hereby authorized to seize the 2001 Ford Expedition, License No. 62C152. The Defendant's interest in said property is hereby forfeited to the United States for disposition in accordance with the law, subject to the provisions of 21 U.S.C., § 853(n)(1). The aforementioned forfeited property is to be held by the United States in its secure custody and control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C., § 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)( GJG, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE sustaining 62 Motion for Preliminary Forfeiture as to Luis P. Mendoza-Ramirez (1). Based upon Count II of the Indictment and the Defendant's plea of guilty, the United States is hereby authorized to seize the 2001 Ford Expedition, License No. 62C152. The Defendant's interest in said property is hereby forfeited to the United States for disposition in accordance with the law, subject to the provisions of 21 U.S.C., § 853(n)(1). The aforementioned forfeited property is to be held by the United States in its secure custody and control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C., § 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)( GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mendoza-Ramirez
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Luis P. Mendoza-Ramirez. The Defendant pleaded guilty to Counts I and II of the Indictment and is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of one hundred eight (108) months; five (5) years of Supervised Release with Special Conditions; $100 Special Assessment. Count II, Defendant shall forfeit a 2001 Ford Expedition, License No. 62C152, registered to Luis Mendoza- Ramirez. Final Order of forfeiture forthcoming as to defendant Luis P. Mendoza-Ramirez Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 Certified copies to USM)(GJG, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Luis P. Mendoza-Ramirez. The Defendant pleaded guilty to Counts I and II of the Indictment and is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of one hundred eight (108) months; five (5) years of Supervised Release with Special Conditions; $100 Special Assessment. Count II, Defendant shall forfeit a 2001 Ford Expedition, License No. 62C152, registered to Luis Mendoza- Ramirez. Final Order of forfeiture forthcoming as to defendant Luis P. Mendoza-Ramirez Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 Certified copies to USM)(GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mendoza-Ramirez
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE regarding motion. The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture 69 is hereby sustained. All right, title and interest in and to the 2001 Ford Expedition, License No. 62C152, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The same hereby is, forfeited to the United States of America. The United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska are directed to dispose of said properties in accordance with law. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)(LKH)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE regarding motion. The Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture 69 is hereby sustained. All right, title and interest in and to the 2001 Ford Expedition, License No. 62C152, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The same hereby is, forfeited to the United States of America. The United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska are directed to dispose of said properties in accordance with law. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 Certified copy to USM)(LKH)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mendoza-Ramirez
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Luis P. Mendoza-Ramirez. It is ordered that: (1)The government's request for hearing is granted.(2)A hearing on the government's motion for reduction of sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 73 has been set before the undersigned United States district judge on Friday, January 29, 2010, at 10:30 a.m., in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska.(3)At the request of the defendant through his counsel, the defendant will participate in the hearing by telephone.(4)The Marshal is directed not to return the defendant to the district.(5)The defendant is held to have waived his right to be present.(6)Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw.(7)The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher.(8)The Clerk of the Court shall provide a copy of this order to counsel for the government and counsel for the defendant. The undersigned's judicial assistant will provide a copy to the Federal Public Defender. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to defendant Luis P. Mendoza-Ramirez. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw.(7)The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher.(8)The Clerk of the Court shall provide a copy of this order to counsel for the government and counsel for the defendant. The undersigned's judicial assistant will provide a copy to the Federal Public Defender. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )
